content.description: Two projectiles are launched from a level surface. Projectile <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has an initial launch velocity <math alttext="vector v sub 0 equals, A i hat, plus A j hat" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo>â†’</mo> </mover> <mn>0</mn> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mi>A</mi> <mover accent="true"> <mi>i</mi> <mo>^</mo> </mover> <mo>+</mo> <mi>A</mi> <mover accent="true"> <mi>j</mi> <mo>^</mo> </mover> </mstyle> </math>, where <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> is a positive constant, as shown. Projectile <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is launched with a different initial velocity such that its horizontal range and time of flight is four times greater than that of Projectile <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
content.question: Which vector could represent the initial velocity of Projectile <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math>?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of an arrow in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The arrow begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right to the point with coordinates A comma 4 A.

topic.text: 1.5: Motion in Two or Three Dimensions
